Content.Name: Money Box
Content.Description: Paul Lewis brings you the latest news from the world of personal finance, and impartial money advice

Content.Name: Midnight News
Content.Description: The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4

Content.Name: The Diary
Content.Description: Stories and insights into the secret world of ordinary diary writers: quirky, embarrassing, poignant, funny, boring, obsessive, but definitely good for you

Content.Name: First Taste
Content.Description: Writers explore the powerful link between taste and memory

Content.Name: Shipping Forecast
Content.Description: The latest Shipping Forecast

Content.Name: As BBC World Service
Content.Description: BBC Radio 4 joins the BBC World Service for a selection of news and current affairs, arts and science programmes

Content.Name: Radio 4 Open Up
Content.Description: Includes a News Summary, the latest Shipping and Inshore Waters forecasts, and Coastal Reports

Content.Name: Bells on Sunday
Content.Description: A chance to hear the peal of the bells from St Paul's Cathedral in London ringing Stedman Cinques

Content.Name: World Report
Content.Description: The programme that brings analysis and context to events around the world

Content.Name: Something Understood
Content.Description: Be the Change! Mark Tully considers Mahatma Gandhi's instruction: You must be the change you wish to see in the world

Content.Name: Living World
Content.Description: Seeds on the Breeze: Lionel Kelleway discovers the ingenious examples of engineering and design to be found in plant seeds when he joins botanist Phil Gates

Content.Name: Sunday
Content.Description: Edward Stourton and guests look back on the big religious stories of 2005 and consider what effect they will have on the religious landscape in 2006

Content.Name: Radio 4 Appeal
Content.Description: Sian Williams appeals on behalf of The Link Centre for Deafened People

Content.Name: Sunday Worship
Content.Description: Beloved of God: John Tavener and the Rev Stephen Shipley explore, at the beginning of his 250th anniversary year, Mozart's ability to express the joys and sorrows of God's creation

Content.Name: A Point of View
Content.Description: David Cannadine presents a weekly reflection on a topical issue

Content.Name: Broadcasting House
Content.Description: Patrick O'Connell presents a fresh and irreverent approach to the news, discussing the top stories of the week with her studio guests

Content.Name: The Archers Omnibus
Content.Description: A chance to catch up on the week's events in Ambridge

Content.Name: Desert Island Discs
Content.Description: Sue Lawley invites the athlete Dame Kelly Holmes to choose eight records to take to Radio 4's mythical desert island

Content.Name: I'm Sorry I Haven't a Clue
Content.Description: The perennial antidote to panel games

Content.Name: The Food Programme
Content.Description: Sheila Dillon asks why we no longer seem to eat in harmony with the seasons and discusses how to rediscover the habit with food writer Nigel Slater

Content.Name: The World this Weekend
Content.Description: A look at events around the world

Content.Name: Ainsley's First Kitchen
Content.Description: TV chef Ainsley Harriott returns to his childhood home in South London and relives some of the food and family experiences that made Christmas special

Content.Name: Gardeners' Question Time
Content.Description: Gill Pyrah chairs a special New Year edition of the programme from Strasbourg where John Cushnie, Bob Flowerdew and Anne Swithinbank are guests of the Council of Europe

Content.Name: Classic Serial
Content.Description: The French Lieutenant's Woman, by John Fowles

Content.Name: Bookclub
Content.Description: George MacDonald Fraser took Flashman, the bully from Tom Brown's Schooldays, and gave him a new lease of life with a career in the army

Content.Description: Roger McGough features listeners' requests for poetry about birds, including Thomas Hardy's The Darkling Thrush and George Meredith's The Lark Ascending

Content.Description: Journalist and broadcaster Charles Wheeler recreates the disputes and fears that Churchill's cabinet had to struggle with during the darkest days of the Second World War

Content.Name: The Archers
Content.Description: The New Year brings new gossip
